intro: Otomeria blommaertii, commonly known as the Blommaert's otomeria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
